channel.description: Recent content in Engineering-at-Meta on Daily Tech Articles Feed

item.title: DrP: Meta‚Äôs Root Cause Analysis Platform at Scale
item.description: Meta recently introduced DrP, a root cause analysis platform that automates incident investigations. With over 300 teams using DrP, it performs 50,000 analyses daily, reducing the mean time to resolve incidents by 20-80%. Key features include an expressive SDK for creating analyzers, a scalable backend for executing them, and seamless integration with existing workflows. Learn more about how DrP enhances system reliability! üîçüíª‚öôÔ∏è #Meta #RootCauseAnalysis #IncidentManagement #TechInnovation…

item.title: How We Built Meta Ray-Ban Display: From Zero to Polish
item.description: üöÄ Delve into the development of the Meta Ray-Ban Display, Meta’s latest AI glasses! In a recent episode of the Meta Tech Podcast, Kenan and Emanuel from the Wearables team discuss the challenges faced in designing these innovative glasses. They explore topics from display technology to unique user interface patterns. Discover how particle physics relates to hardware design and the importance of celebrating small victories in a fast-paced environment. Listen now on your favorite podcast…

item.title: How AI Is Transforming the Adoption of Secure-by-Default Mobile Frameworks
item.description: Meta is advancing mobile security with its secure-by-default frameworks. These frameworks wrap potentially unsafe OS and third-party functions, ensuring security is a priority while keeping development fast and user-friendly. AI and automation are key in scaling these frameworks across Meta‚Äôs codebase, helping to identify insecure patterns and enforce consistent security measures. Balancing security, usability, and performance is crucial in framework design to encourage developer adoption and…

item.title: Zoomer: Powering AI Performance at Meta‚Äôs Scale Through Intelligent Debugging and Optimization
item.description: üöÄ Introducing Zoomer, Meta’s new automated debugging and optimization platform for AI! Zoomer enhances performance across Meta’s training and inference workloads, providing insights that lead to energy savings and improved workflow efficiency. It has significantly reduced training times and improved query per second (QPS) metrics. Operating at scale, Zoomer helps eliminate GPU underutilization, ensuring resources are used effectively, which in turn supports faster model iterations and product…

item.title: Key Transparency Comes to Messenger
item.description: üîí Messenger has launched key transparency verification for end-to-end encrypted chats. This feature enhances security by ensuring only you and your contacts can access your messages. Key transparency provides an auditable record of public keys, helping users confirm their conversations are encrypted correctly. This reduces the need for manual key comparisons across devices. This advancement builds on industry efforts, similar to WhatsApp’s implementation. #Messenger #KeyTransparency…

item.title: Efficient Optimization With Ax, an Open Platform for Adaptive Experimentation
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news from Meta! We’ve launched Ax 1.0, an open-source platform designed for adaptive experimentation using machine learning. Ax helps improve AI models, optimize production infrastructure, and advance ML and hardware design. üåü Our new paper, ‚ÄúAx: A Platform for Adaptive Experimentation,‚Äù details Ax‚Äôs architecture and compares its performance with other optimization libraries. Discover how Ax can enhance your research and experimentation process! #MachineLearning #OpenSource #AI…

item.title: Announcing the Completion of the Core 2Africa System: Building the Future of Connectivity Together
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news! The core 2Africa infrastructure is now complete, marking the world‚Äôs longest open access subsea cable system. This landmark project connects East and West Africa, linking 33 countries across three continents, providing connectivity to over 3 billion people. üåç The initiative, led by Meta and global partners, aims to enhance digital experiences and foster economic growth in Africa and beyond. #2Africa #Connectivity #DigitalTransformation #SubseaCable #AfricaTech

item.title: Enhancing HDR on Instagram for iOS With Dolby Vision
item.description: üì± Instagram has enhanced its iOS app by integrating Dolby Vision and ambient viewing environment (amve) support, improving the video experience for users. This update allows HDR videos from iPhones to maintain unique metadata, ensuring better color, brightness, and contrast across various displays. Instagram is now the first Meta app to fully support Dolby Vision, with plans for broader adoption across other Meta applications in the future. #InstagramUpdate #DolbyVision #VideoExperience #Meta…

item.title: Open Source Is Good for the Environment
item.description: üåç Open-source isn’t just for software; it extends to hardware too! In the latest episode of the Meta Tech Podcast, Pascal Hartig discusses the environmental benefits of open hardware with Dharmesh and Lisa. They highlight Meta’s initiatives from the 2025 Open Compute Project Summit, including a new AI methodology to tackle Scope 3 emissions. Discover how AI is aiding in the development of sustainable concrete for data center construction as Meta aims for net zero emissions by 2030. üéß Listen…

item.title: StyleX: A Styling Library for CSS at Scale
item.description: üöÄ StyleX is Meta’s innovative styling system designed for large-scale applications. It merges the benefits of CSS-in-JS with the efficiency of static CSS, producing collision-free atomic CSS. Since its open-source launch in late 2023, StyleX has become the standard for Meta products like Facebook and Instagram. This compiler extracts styles at build time and facilitates intuitive styling across teams, enhancing predictability and scalability. #Meta #StyleX #CSStips #WebDevelopment #OpenSource

item.title: Meta‚Äôs Generative Ads Model (GEM): The Central Brain Accelerating Ads Recommendation AI Innovation
item.description: üöÄ Meta introduces the Generative Ads Recommendation Model (GEM), enhancing ad performance and advertiser ROI by improving ad relevance. GEM’s architecture scales efficiently with more parameters, utilizing advanced GPU training techniques to deliver precise predictions. Since its launch, GEM has increased ad conversions by 5% on Instagram and 3% on Facebook Feed. This innovation marks a significant leap in ad recommendation systems. #Meta #GEM #AdsInnovation #AI #Advertising

item.title: Video Invisible Watermarking at Scale
item.description: Meta is utilizing invisible watermarking to enhance content provenance on its platforms. This technology helps detect AI-generated videos, verify original posters, and track content sources. üåê The article discusses the challenges faced in scaling this watermarking solution, including the development of a CPU-based system that matches GPU performance while improving efficiency. üîß Invisible watermarking embeds data within media files, ensuring persistent identification even after edits or…

item.title: Scaling Privacy Infrastructure for GenAI Product Innovation
item.description: Meta is enhancing product innovation through its Privacy Aware Infrastructure (PAI) to ensure responsible use of GenAI. The focus is on AI glasses as a key example of how GenAI enables new features while prioritizing user trust and data protection. Key challenges include managing explosive data growth, adapting to shifting privacy requirements, and supporting rapid innovation cycles. Explore how Meta balances innovation with privacy! üîç‚ú® #Meta #GenAI #Privacy #Innovation #AI

item.title: Disaggregated Scheduled Fabric: Scaling Meta‚Äôs AI Journey
item.description: üöÄ Meta introduces the Disaggregated Schedule Fabric (DSF), a cutting-edge network technology designed for AI training. This innovation addresses the limitations of traditional Clos-based networks. DSF enables scalable AI networks by separating hardware components into interconnected devices, enhancing performance and load balancing. It supports large clusters of GPUs, crucial for handling the growing demand for high-performance AI. The article highlights challenges faced with traditional IP…

item.title: Scaling LLM Inference: Innovations in Tensor Parallelism, Context Parallelism, and Expert Parallelism
item.description: At Meta, we are advancing LLM inference systems to enhance applications like the Meta AI App. We focus on optimizing resource efficiency, throughput, and latency using techniques like tensor, context, and expert parallelism. These methods help manage the demands of large language models during both the prefill and decoding stages. Our goal is to improve GPU utilization, increase query handling, and minimize response times for a smooth user experience. #MetaAI #LLMInference #Parallelism #AI…

item.title: Branching in a Sapling Monorepo
item.description: üå± Exciting insights from the GitMerge 2024 conference on branching in Sapling, Meta’s open-source source control system! Sapling supports a large monorepo, addressing the challenges of branching workflows. The article discusses tradeoffs between scalability and developer experience, highlighting two effective workflows: non-mergeable full-repo branching and mergeable directory branching. Key takeaways include how these workflows resolved branching issues for diverse products at Meta. The…

item.title: 10X Backbone: How Meta Is Scaling Backbone Connectivity for AI
item.description: Meta is enhancing its Backbone network to meet the growing demands of AI workloads. üåê The Backbone consists of two main networks: Classic Backbone (CBB) for global reach and Express Backbone (EBB) for scalable data center interconnections. EBB, which has been growing since 2015, faces significant scalability challenges. üöÄ Meta’s focus is on evolving EBB to ensure reliable, high-capacity connections as new data centers are built. #Meta #AI #Networking #DataCenters #TechInnovation

item.title: Design for Sustainability: New Design Principles for Reducing IT Hardware Emissions
item.description: üå± Meta introduces “Design for Sustainability,” a set of principles aimed at reducing emissions and costs in IT hardware. These guidelines focus on modularity, reuse, and energy efficiency to extend the life of data center racks and minimize environmental impact. Meta encourages the industry to adopt these strategies to achieve sustainability goals. üìä‚ôªÔ∏è #Sustainability #GreenTech #Innovation #Meta #ITHardware

item.title: How Meta Is Leveraging AI To Improve the Quality of Scope 3 Emission Estimates for IT Hardware
item.description: Meta is advancing its goal of achieving net zero emissions by 2030 by focusing on Scope 3 emissions from IT hardware. At the 2025 OCP EMEA summit, Meta introduced a new AI-driven methodology to enhance carbon emission estimates. This approach combines cost-based estimates and component-specific carbon footprints to improve understanding of emissions across various hardware components. The collaboration aims to open-source this methodology for the industry. By leveraging AI, Meta seeks to…

item.title: OCP Summit 2025: The Open Future of Networking Hardware for AI
item.description: üåê At the OCP Summit 2025, Meta outlined advancements in network fabrics tailored for AI training clusters. üìà The company expanded its hardware portfolio, introducing new disaggregated network platforms to enhance collaboration within the Open Compute Project. üîß Meta emphasized the importance of open hardware in driving innovation and improving data center efficiency. Key milestones include the evolution of Disaggregated Scheduled Fabric and the launch of the Ethernet for Scale-Up Networking…

item.title: Introducing the React Foundation: The New Home for React & React Native
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for the React community! Meta has announced the formation of the React Foundation, aimed at supporting React and React Native. This transition will formalize governance and ensure independent technical direction, with a board including representatives from major companies like Amazon and Microsoft. Meta is committing over $3 million and five years of support to help with this transition. The foundation will maintain infrastructure, organize events, and foster collaboration…

item.title: Introducing OpenZL: An Open Source Format-Aware Compression Framework
item.description: üöÄ Introducing OpenZL, a new open source compression framework designed for structured data. OpenZL offers lossless compression with performance comparable to specialized compressors while maintaining the simplicity of a single executable binary. You can start using OpenZL today! Check out the Quick Start guide and GitHub repository for more details. #OpenZL #DataCompression #OpenSource #TechInnovation #StructuredData

item.title: Introducing the Candle Subsea Cable, Updates to Our Asia-Pacific Connectivity Projects
item.description: üåä Exciting news in connectivity! Meta has introduced Candle, a new submarine cable set to connect East and Southeast Asia. This cable will be the largest capacity system in the region, enhancing connectivity for over 580 million people by 2028. Additionally, updates on the Bifrost cable system have been shared, alongside progress on the Echo and Apricot cables. These initiatives aim to support the growing demand for robust internet infrastructure in the Asia-Pacific region. #Connectivity…

item.title: Accelerating our Android apps with Baseline Profiles
item.description: üöÄ Exciting advancements in Android app performance at Meta! We’ve leveraged Android‚Äôs Baseline Profiles to enhance app efficiency, addressing user needs that have become more complex over time. üìà By using user data and fine-tuning our approach, we’ve improved performance metrics by up to 40%. This helps tackle slow startups and responsiveness issues, ensuring a smoother experience for billions of users. Learn more about our infrastructure and the challenges we faced! #AndroidDevelopment #Meta…

item.title: LLMs Are the Key to Mutation Testing and Better Compliance
item.description: Meta is advancing software testing with its Automated Compliance Hardening (ACH) tool, powered by large language models (LLMs). This tool automates compliance adherence and enhances developer efficiency. By using LLMs, Meta simplifies risk assessments, reduces developer workload, and fosters continuous compliance, creating safer online environments. Meta also invites the community to engage in challenges like the JiTTest Challenge, exploring new opportunities in software testing. #Meta…

item.title: AssetGen: Generating 3D Worlds With AI
item.description: üåê Exciting developments in AI and VR were highlighted at Meta Connect. Mark Zuckerberg shared a vision of creating 3D virtual worlds easily using AI prompts. The new Meta Horizon Studio aims to empower creators with this technology. On the Meta Tech Podcast, experts discussed AssetGen, a model designed to generate 3D assets from simple text, showcasing the future of immersive experiences. üéß Listen to the episode on your favorite podcast platform! #AI #VR #MetaConnect #3DWorlds #MetaTech

item.title: Meta‚Äôs Infrastructure Evolution and the Advent of AI
item.description: Meta has transformed over 21 years from a small social network to a global platform serving 3.4 billion users. üåç The company‚Äôs infrastructure has evolved significantly, addressing challenges through innovative solutions, especially with the rise of AI. This evolution requires advancements at all levels, from hardware to data centers. Meta remains committed to open-source principles, sharing developments with the engineering community. #Meta #AI #Infrastructure #OpenSource #TechInnovation

item.title: Networking at the Heart of AI ‚Äî @Scale: Networking 2025 Recap
item.description: üåê AI is transforming networking, and this year’s @Scale:Networking event highlighted its critical role. Engineers from major tech companies gathered to discuss the infrastructure needed for AI advancements. üîç Key topics included significant investments in AI infrastructure, with companies planning extensive builds and renewable energy initiatives. üìà Additionally, the evolution of AI models and workloads was a focus, showcasing rapid growth and increasing demands on network performance….

item.title: Video Streaming With the AV1 Video Codec in Mobile Devices
item.description: üì¢ Today, Meta, Vodafone, and Google released a white paper on the benefits of the AV1 video codec for mobile streaming. The document advises core processor vendors to consider adopting AV1 hardware or, if not feasible, to implement software-based AV1 decoders. This is crucial as video content makes up 70-80% of mobile data traffic. üì± AV1 can enhance video quality in low- and mid-tier devices, matching premium handsets while optimizing network capacity. Collaboration between content providers…

item.title: Read Meta‚Äôs 2025 Sustainability Report
item.description: üåç Meta has released its 2025 Sustainability Report, outlining its commitment to environmental responsibility. The report details strategies for reducing carbon emissions and promoting renewable energy use across its operations. Key initiatives and progress updates reflect Meta‚Äôs ongoing efforts to enhance sustainability and accountability. #Sustainability #Meta2025 #ClimateAction #RenewableEnergy #CorporateResponsibility üå±

item.title: A New Ranking Framework for Better Notification Quality on Instagram
item.description: Meta is enhancing Instagram notifications using machine learning and diversity algorithms. A new framework aims to reduce uniformity, offering a varied mix of notifications while lowering overall volume. This approach boosts engagement rates by ensuring users discover diverse content and creators. The goal is to balance personalization with a richer notification experience, avoiding overexposure to the same authors. #InstagramUpdates #MachineLearning #UserExperience #Diversity #SocialMedia

item.title: Enabling Kotlin incremental compilation on Buck2
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for Kotlin developers! Meta has integrated the Kotlin incremental compiler into Buck2, enhancing speed and efficiency. This incremental approach reduces compilation time by focusing on changed files, a significant improvement as codebases grow. Some modules now build up to 3x faster! Learn more about the integration process and its impact on developer productivity. #Kotlin #Buck2 #IncrementalCompilation #Meta #DeveloperProductivity

item.title: Creating AI agent solutions for warehouse data access and security
item.description: Meta is evolving its data warehouse to enhance productivity and security for both human users and AI agents. ü§ñüîí We are developing AI agents to streamline data access requests, helping users find the data they need while assisting data owners in maintaining security. Guardrails, such as auditing and feedback systems, are also being implemented to ensure safe operations. As the scale and complexity of data access grow, our focus is on minimizing security risks while improving efficiency. This…

item.title: Federation Platform and Privacy Waves: How Meta distributes compliance-related tasks at scale
item.description: Meta is enhancing privacy compliance with its Federation Platform and Privacy Waves program. These tools manage compliance tasks effectively and ensure accountability across teams. üåê The Federation Platform breaks down compliance initiatives into manageable tasks, while Privacy Waves organizes these tasks into monthly batches for better planning. üìÖ Together, they improve user data protection and streamline operations, managing over 100,000 tasks annually. This approach is expanding into…

item.title: Diff Risk Score: AI-driven risk-aware software development
item.description: üöÄ Introducing the Diff Risk Score (DRS) from Meta! This AI-driven technology predicts the likelihood of code changes causing production incidents, enhancing software development processes. By analyzing code changes and metadata, DRS generates risk scores, allowing developers to identify potentially risky code. üõ†Ô∏è DRS has notably reduced code freezes during critical periods, boosting productivity while maintaining user experience. For instance, during a key event in 2024, over 10,000 code…

item.title: Building a human-computer interface for everyone
item.description: Discover how Meta’s Reality Labs is advancing human-computer interaction with wrist-worn devices using surface electromyography (sEMG). ü§ñ Their research focuses on creating a universal input device that adapts to different users. Generalization remains a key challenge, as existing models often cater to individual gestures. Listen to the latest episode of the Meta Tech Podcast to learn more about this innovative approach! üéß‚ú® #HumanComputerInteraction #TechInnovation #MetaTech #sEMG #Podcast
